meanings.definition: Opposing or rejecting the dominant culture or societal norms.
meanings.sent1: The countercultural group held a peaceful protest against the new law.
meanings.sent2: Her countercultural fashion choices always stood out in a crowd.
meanings.sent3: The countercultural cat refused to conform to the trend of chasing mice.
meanings.sent4: His countercultural ideas were like a bright light in a sea of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The countercultural movement spread like wildfire, challenging traditional beliefs.

meanings.definition: Relating to a movement or group that opposes mainstream culture.
meanings.sent1: The countercultural music festival attracted a diverse crowd.
meanings.sent2: Their countercultural art exhibit showcased unique perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The countercultural picnic featured unconventional food choices.
meanings.sent4: Her countercultural spirit shone through in every aspect of her life.
meanings.sent5: The countercultural revolution brought new ideas to the forefront of society.

meanings.definition: Characterized by values or beliefs that go against the norm.
meanings.sent1: The countercultural book club discussed controversial topics openly.
meanings.sent2: His countercultural approach to education challenged traditional methods.
meanings.sent3: The countercultural garden grew vegetables in unexpected patterns.
meanings.sent4: Their countercultural lifestyle was a beacon of individuality.
meanings.sent5: The countercultural philosophy encouraged thinking outside the box.
